intro: Diascia vigilis, commonly known as the night blooming scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, glandular leaves that are often blue or gray-green in color. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Diascia vigilis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
